Luther College University Of Regina Admission Requirements, English Language Proficiency Requirements, Steps on how to apply Nigerian Applicants Admission Requirements.

The Luther College University of Regina Admission is ongoing for all international candidates who wish to apply for admission; The admission is open for all nationals.

Luther College University of Regina Admission requirements and Admission processes are outlined below for all interested applicants:

Nigeria Admission Requirements

Applying from secondary school

  • West African Examinations Council (WAEC)
  • Candidates will need to purchase a scratch card and provide the Admissions Office with the following information: Examination Number, Examination Year, Type of Examination, Card Serial Number, and PIN (www.waecdirect.org/)
  • For faculty-specific requirements, please click here

Transferring students from another post-secondary institution

  • Original transcripts of grades have to be sent DIRECTLY from all post-secondary institutions attended to our Admissions Office
  • Diploma (when attained)
  • Applicants with Non-Canadian Credentials must present their original transcript of marks directly from the institution they attended (for courses completed towards an undergraduate program only), copies of diplomas of qualifications obtained, or a WES ICAP consideration (International Credential Advantage Package) sent directly from WES to the suitable Enrolment Services Office.
  • If  the necessary credentials are not in English or French, a notarized English translation must go with  the credentials or be presented to the Admissions Office
  • For faculty-specific necessities, please click here to clarify your faulty requirements.

Steps on how to apply for Luther College University of Regina

It is easy to apply to study on exchange at the University of Regina. Here are the steps:

Step 1: get in touch with your home institution’s Study Abroad representative to see if your institution shares an exchange agreement with the U of R.

Step 2: Complete an online application. (See the following for detailed instructions):

  • Click here to login as a new user
  • Fill in the appropriate information to log in to the form site

Step 3: forward the necessary documents to Study.Abroad@uregina.ca.

Step 4: Select your program by checking out U of R’s online catalog.

Step 5: ensure to request transcripts before leaving.
